issues.description: The addGuestStudents method in the template repository has an extra parameter (boolean validateInput) compared to what is specified in the problem statement and implemented in the solution repository. This discrepancy could confuse students, as the problem and UML diagram specify a method with only one integer parameter, but the template provides a signature with two parameters, potentially leading students to implement an incorrect version or struggle to reconcile the differences.
issues.suggested_fix: Modify the addGuestStudents method in the template repository to match the specified signature by removing the boolean validateInput parameter, changing it to 'public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents)' to align with the problem statement and solution, ensuring students can implement the intended design without confusion.
